DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the kind of Flourescence in Situ Hybridization probe used that is captured in the image.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Fluorescence in Situ Hybridization Image Probe
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping._Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic._General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.:Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Concepts.definition: A physical mapping approach that uses fluorescent tags to detect hybridization of probes within metaphase chromosomes or less condensed somatic interphase chromatin. This technique can be used for identification of chromosomal abnormalities and for gene mapping.
Any record of an imaging event whether physical or electronic.

Property.preferredDefinition: General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.

Concepts.definition: General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for HTMCP slide submission form per request by K.Dicostanzo. mc 11/12/14

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the kind of probe used for FISH.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Small non-coding RNA that is encoded by Epstein-Barr virus DNA and transcribed by virally-infected cells throughout the latent cycle. Expression of these oligonucleotides may be associated with the regulation of host ribosome function.: General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.

Concepts.definition: Small non-coding RNA that is encoded by Epstein-Barr virus DNA and transcribed by virally-infected cells throughout the latent cycle. Expression of these oligonucleotides may be associated with the regulation of host ribosome function.

General term for a piece of DNA or RNA corresponding to a gene or sequence of interest, that has been labelled either radioactively or with some other detectable molecule, such as biotin, digoxygenin or fluorescein. As stretches of DNA or RNA with complementary sequences will hybridize, a probe will label viral plaques, bacterial colonies or bands on a gel that contain the gene of interest.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: RARA Dual Color Break-Apart Rearrangement Probe

ValueMeaning.preferredName: RARA Dual Color Break-Apart Rearrangement Probe
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A DNA FISH probe designed to detect chromosomal rearrangements involving the RARA gene region at chromosome 17q21.1. It is designed to differentially label the proximal and distal regions of RARA and can detect rearrangements between the RARA gene and any translocation partner.

Concepts.longName: RARA Dual Color Break-Apart Rearrangement Probe
Concepts.definition: A DNA FISH probe designed to detect chromosomal rearrangements involving the RARA gene region at chromosome 17q21.1. It is designed to differentially label the proximal and distal regions of RARA and can detect rearrangements between the RARA gene and any translocation partner.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A mixture of three FISH DNA probes. Two probes hybridize to the 15q22 region containing the PML gene, one recognizes the 5' side of the break point and the other binds to the 3' side, while the third hybridizes to the 17q21.1 region containing the RARA gene. The PML probes are labeled with one fluorescent dye and the RARA probe is labeled with a different color fluorescence dye; therefore this probe set can uniquely distinguish intact and rearranged genes.

Concepts.definition: A mixture of three FISH DNA probes. Two probes hybridize to the 15q22 region containing the PML gene, one recognizes the 5' side of the break point and the other binds to the 3' side, while the third hybridizes to the 17q21.1 region containing the RARA gene. The PML probes are labeled with one fluorescent dye and the RARA probe is labeled with a different color fluorescence dye; therefore this probe set can uniquely distinguish intact and rearranged genes.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Removed special characters for MDR data migration. 3.16.20 mc

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A set of two DNA probes designed for use in FISH; one hybridizes to either the 15q22 region containing the PML gene or the 17q21.1 region containing the RARA gene. This probe set detects the PML/RARA fusion gene.

Concepts.definition: A set of two DNA probes designed for use in FISH; one hybridizes to either the 15q22 region containing the PML gene or the 17q21.1 region containing the RARA gene. This probe set detects the PML/RARA fusion gene.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.
